subject: Career
title: Keystone Habits for Well-Being
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Keystone Habits for Well-Being.

hook.text: She started exercising 30 minutes a day. Then she slept better. Then ate better. Then felt less stressed. One habit.

buildup.text: Charles Duhigg's keystone habits: certain habits trigger chain reactions that improve many areas of life.

discovery.text: Exercise is the most powerful keystone habit. It improves sleep, mood, cognition, and stress resilience simultaneously.

twist.text: You don't need to fix everything at once. Find one keystone habit and the others follow.

climax.text: Top keystones for burnout recovery: exercise, consistent sleep schedule, and morning routines without screens.

punchline.text: Change one habit. Watch everything else shift.

quiz.question: What is a keystone habit?
options: A habit that triggers chain reactions improving many areas of life
The most difficult habit to form
A habit that only affects one area
